intro: Hieracium valgidentatum, commonly known as the rough-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive lobed shape, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in temperate regions and is considered a perennial herb.
